title: Library Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Johannesburg (Johannesburg)
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview. They were all friendly and helpful. The interview was smooth and easy. Most questions were about myself, customer service. No scenarios. Just be you. The interview did not take long.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself? Why do you think you are the best candidate for this job?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Johannesburg (Johannesburg) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: writing a job description, posting a job, scheduling interviews, conducting preliminary interviews, conducting in-person interviews, following up with candidates and making a hire. Introductions. Small Talk. Information Gathering. Question/Answer. Wrapping Up.

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 10 months. I interviewed at University of Johannesburg
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I was contacted by HR for interview several months later. They also requested referees whom they contacted for references. The interview was then also held online with a panel of around 6 people. HR then took over six months to give feedback after the interview and ignored emails requesting updates.
Interview Questions: Asked about experience, pedagogy, research, familiarity with teaching and learning theory.

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Johannesburg in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: The process was average, they wanted to get to know me better and understand why I wanted the post. It was important for them to know why I was passionate about making a career in academia
Interview Questions: What does teaching mean to you

title: Tutoring Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Johannesburg
Interview Descriptions: It was scary, but it taught me how to approach interview questions, first interview ever, give it your best shot, Be very prepared, test yourself, ask yourself question  and you'll be all good
Interview Questions: The difficulties you had and how you overcame that

title: Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Johannesburg
Interview Descriptions: Quick and straight forward. They asked me questions that allowed them to see what I can bring to the company. The interview process took roughly 30 minutes. It was a really good interview

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Johannesburg (Johannesburg) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview due to Covid restrictions. The interviewer was very bubbly and made me feel at ease. The interview was more of a informal discussion about what i could bring to the table and my career aspirations.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
What innovative ideas do you have to overcome tutoring in the Covid era?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Johannesburg (Johannesburg) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process was fairly easy and straight forward. They basically just wanted to know about your background and what value you'll bring to the team.  You'll need to provide your academic record.
Interview Questions: Where are you from and why should we hire you?

title: Food & Beverage Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Johannesburg (Johannesburg) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Both panel and practicals Panel asked about previous work experience and values will be adding to the organisation. Ideally the plan was to share my international experience in the food industry which was a good balance to my qulaifications.

title: HR Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Johannesburg (Johannesburg)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and I was called few weeks after that I have been shortlisted.the interview went smooth and it was a conversation and an interesting experience that I will choose to do over again

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Johannesburg (Johannesburg) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant and brief, I was alerted via email of the interview, which took about 30-minutes. The questions were pretty standard and easy to answer. The management within the department were clearly looking for well-balanced candidates.
Interview Questions: What particular topic, did you love and why? Should I struggle to understand it, explain it to me in two-sentences.

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Johannesburg (Johannesburg) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was as proffesional as much as i expected it to be. The panel consisted of more than ten members which is a bit scary for a person who might be a first timer on an interview. The panel was impressed about my appearance and how honest i was with my previous experiences outside the university and inside. My confidents also played an important role as the panel continued with their questions.
Interview Questions: Why must the university hire me?
